other_tests.findings: The gallbladder is slightly thick-walled but non-distended. There is a small amount of high T2 signal adjacent to the gallbladder either representing some fluid or possible folding of the gallbladder wall. Gallstones from prior sonography are less evident now. There is a 1.4-cm lobulated cystic lesion at the lower pole of the right kidney with indeterminate appearances.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Gallstones from prior sonography are less evident now.
